alert.note: Alert for Chautauqua; Erie; Livingston; Ontario; Wyoming (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 12 at 2:27AM EST until November 12 at 1:32PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of western New York, including the following counties, Allegany, Cattaraugus, Chautauqua, Erie, Livingston, Ontario and Wyoming. * WHEN...Until 530 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 225 AM EST, local law enforcement reported continued flooding issues from earlier heavy rain in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts will be light across the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jamestown, Olean, Salamanca, Dansville, Wellsville, Allegany State Park, Letchworth State Park, Springville, Alfred, Perry, Warsaw, Lakewood, Mount Morris, Gowanda, Conesus, Falconer, Ashford, Arcade, Allegany and Franklinville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
